An 83-year-old woman with sepsis develops multiorgan failure. Based on her blood urea nitrogen of >100 mg/dL, she is placed on continuous veno-venous haemodialysis. Which of the following factors will increase the diffusive clearance of solutes across the semipermeable dialysis membrane?

options.label: C
options.text: Lipid solubility of the solutes decreases

questions.correct_answer: A. Area of the membrane increases

questions.text: Which of the following will occur if blood flow to an alveolus is totally obstructed by a pulmonary thromboembolism?

options.label: B
options.text: Po2 of the alveolus will be equal to that in the inspired air

questions.correct_answer: B. Po2 of the alveolus will be equal to that in the inspired air

questions.text: An 84-year-old female was found to have a blood pressure of 85/60 mmHg, heart rate 101beats/min, temperature 37.8°C. questions.text: During a psychiatric interview a patient was asked, “What is the thing to do, if you find an envelope in the street that is sealed, stamped and addressed?”. Which part of the mental status examination here is being tested?

During the psychiatric interview, a person was asked “what is the similarity between a table and a chair, and he replied that both have four legs.” What is the thinking abnormality most likely in this patient?
The term used in psychiatry to describe unreal sensation of mind, in which the person has “out of self” experiences, with intact reality contact?
All of the following are correctly matched except:

options.label: A
options.text: Continuous irrelevant intrusive thoughts about having HIV infection and handwashing-Hypochondriasis

options.label: B
options.text: Sudden loss of limb movements Conversion disorder

questions.correct_answer: A. Continuous irrelevant intrusive thoughts about having HIV infection and handwashing-Hypochondriasis

questions.text: An 8-year-old girl presents to the psychiatrist to discuss the recent divorce of her parents. The girl explains that her mother is the most caring and loving mother anyone could ever have and that she will be spending the majority of her time with her mother. On the other hand, she exclaims that her father is an evil person and hates him. Which of the following ego defenses is best demonstrated by this girl?
A 27 years old Primigravida has come to the ANC OPD at 19 weeks of gestation. Which of the following will not be present in this patient?
A case of ectopic pregnancy can be differentiated from a case of pelvic inflammatory disease by all the following except:
A 26 years old primigravida has come to the emergency room with complaints of bleeding per vaginum. Her gestational age is 9 weeks. Which of the following is not the possible cause?

A 25 years old lady presented with acute onset of breathlessness and fatigue since last 8 days. She had a full-term normal delivery 1 month back. She had mild pre-eclampsia during antenatal period but her BP was normal after delivery. Her Hb is 11.2gm%. There is no history of any cardio respiratory disease in past. Her chest X ray is normal. Her 2D echo shows LVEF of 35% with no cardiac lesion. Her ECG is within normal limits. Which of the following is the most likely cause?
A 32 years old nulliparous patient had history of 3 abortions in last 4 years. All her abortions were spontaneous and were of 7-9 weeks. What is the possible cause amongst the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Balanced translocation in patient and partner

questions.correct_answer: C. Balanced translocation in patient and partner

questions.text: Identify the following instrument:
Which of the following is not a complication of MCDA twins?
Which one of the following is not true about magnesium sulphate therapy in a case of eclampsia?

options.label: B
options.text: It is a cerebro-protective agent for mother and baby

options.label: C
options.text: It acts as an anti-hypertensive agent as well

options.label: D
options.text: It can cause respiratory depression and arrest

questions.correct_answer: C. It acts as an anti-hypertensive agent as well

questions.text: Which of the following is not a known complication of a tocolytic RITODRINE?
Which of the following is a contraindication for applying vacuum during delivery?
A 32 years old primigravida has 11 weeks of gestation. Her USG shows septate uterus. What should be the treatment of choice?
A 32 years old nulliparous patient took Rubella vaccine. She wants to know about the duration for which she must avoid pregnancy. You would tell her to avoid pregnancy for how many months?
The most common cause of post-menopausal bleeding is?
Uterus is absent in which of the following cases?
A 5 years old girl has developed breasts with Tanner stage 4. Which of the following is not the possible cause?
Identify the surgical procedure:
Which of the following drugs is not responsible for the following condition in an infertile patient?
A 16 years old girl has not got her periods since last 3 months. Which of the following is the next step of investigation?

A 36 years old multiparous patient has watery discharge per vaginum with pus cells in it. On examination, her cervix is inflamed. There are no other abnormalities in local examination. Which STI kit is necessary in this case?
Partner treatment is not needed in an infection caused by which organism?
A 35 years old nulliparous and infertile patient is advised to undergo hysteroscopy. Which one of the following conditions is not treated by it?
Which one of the following is not an indication of performing APLA syndrome evaluation?

options.label: B
options.text: Past history of unexplained fetal death at 28 weeks

questions.text: Which one of the following is true about the given instrument?

options.label: A
options.text: It is used to do vaginal cytology

options.label: B
options.text: Lateral wall, upper 1/3 of vagina is the site from where it takes vaginal cellular sample

options.label: C
options.text: It is used to do cervical cytology

questions.text: A 12 years old girl had an ovarian tumour which was surgically removed. On histopathological examination, the following picture was seen. Her AFP was very high. Which of the following ovarian tumour is present in her?
A 37 years old lady is advised Latzko operation. What is the likely condition?
Arrange the steps of handwashing in correct format i) Palm to palm; ii) Back of palms, iii) Thumbs iv) Finger and knuckles v) Finger tips
questions.correct_answer: C. i, ii, iv, iii, v

questions.text: Which of the following vaccine is NOT administered after 4 years of age as per IAP 2022 guidelines?

A 5-year-old girl is unresponsive, not breathing, and pulseless. Cardiopulmonary resuscitation is being performed. The cardiac monitor reading is shown below. Which of the following interventions should be performed next?

options.label: C
options.text: Establish vascular access and administer epinephrine.

options.label: D
options.text: Establish vascular access and insert an advanced airway.

questions.text: A child can go up alternating feet, make a tower of 9, knows his full name and does pretend play. He now refers himself by 'I'. What is his estimated developmental age?
A full term baby, 3 kg birth weight has a cord blood TSH of 100mIU/l. What should be the next step?

options.label: B
options.text: Do a complete physical examination and repeat sample

options.label: D
options.text: Start eltroxin and reconfirm with venous sample

questions.correct_answer: D. Start eltroxin and reconfirm with venous sample

questions.text: An infant is being investigated for persistent jaundice and has a systolic murmur consistent with pulmonary valve disease. Ophthalmological assessment reveals an anterior-segment abnormality. What is the most likely skeletal manifestation?

A 7-years-old boy presents with a 10-days history of purpura on his arms and legs. He has had 3 days of pain and swelling of his ankles and left knee but is ambulant. On examination he is apyrexial, his capillary refill is 1 second, pulse 100 beats per minute, blood pressure 105/80 mmHg. Urine dipstick shows blood + + and protein + + +. Bloods on admission revealed haemoglobin 132 g/L, white count 6.7 x 109L, platelets 273 x 109/L, sodium 140 mmol/L, potassium 3.7 mmol/L, urea 3.0 mmol/L, creatinine 42 μmol/L and C reactive protein < 2. Which of the following actions would be the BEST?
All of the following may occur in Noonan’s syndrome except:
Dendritic morphology of the brain pyramidal cells is seen in

options.label: B
options.text: Urea cycle defect due OTC deficiency

questions.text: A 9 day old full-term infant is admitted to the hospital with lethargy, fever, and increasing jaundice. Physical examination also reveals hepatomegaly. Laboratory results reveal a blood glucose value of 10 mg/dL, total and direct bilirubin values of 15 and 7 mg/dL, respectively and liver enzymes AST, 700 units/L, and ALT, 650 units/L. The next day the blood culture is positive for a gram-negative rod. The most likely diagnosis is:
The CT finding is seen in
Which MRI sequence is most sensitive for detecting acute ischemic stroke?
FDG PET negative tumor
SI unit of biological equivalent of radiation is
What is diagnosis in the CT image shown below?
